unalcol.types.collection.misc

Class DisjointSets

  • java.lang.Object
    • unalcol.types.collection.misc.DisjointSets

  • public class DisjointSets
extends java.lang.Object

    Title: DisjointSets

    Description: This class represents a disjoint sets find-union optimal structure as explained by Cormen et all in Introduction to algorithms. Mac Graw Hill, 1990.

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2002

    Company: Universidad Nacional de Colombia - The University of Memphis

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jonatan Gomez

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int[] p
      The canonical object that represents the set which the element belongs to p_i = x means that object i belongs to the set represented by object x
      int[] rank
      The rank of the elements

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DisjointSets(int n)
      Constructor: Creates a disjoint set structure of n objects.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int find(int x)
      Returns the canonical object that represents the set that the object x belongs to
      int[] get()
      Returns the canonical elements for each element in the full set
      void init()
      Initialize the disjoint find union structure.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Converts the disjoin find-union structure to a string return A string with the disjoin find-union structure
      int union(int x, int y)
      Performs the union of the set that contains element x with the set that contains the element y

    • Constructor Detail

      • DisjointSets

        public DisjointSets(int n)
        Constructor: Creates a disjoint set structure of n objects. Each element defines a set. p_x = x
        Parameters:
        n - Number of elements

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
        Initialize the disjoint find union structure. p_x = x, rank_x = 0

      • find

        public int find(int x)
        Returns the canonical object that represents the set that the object x belongs to
        Parameters:
        x - Element used to determine the canonical object
        Returns:
        the canonical object that represents the set that the object x belongs to

      • union

        public int union(int x,
                 int y)
        Performs the union of the set that contains element x with the set that contains the element y
        Parameters:
        x - The object that defines the first set to be joint
        y - The object that defines the second set to be joint
        Returns:
        The canonical object of the union set.

      • get

        public int[] get()
        Returns the canonical elements for each element in the full set
        Returns:
        The canonical elements for each element in the full set
